Reference

Overview of the package

sars2pack-package

sars2pack: Easy access to and use of iconic COVID-19 data resource

Data resources

Data resources that are accessible from this package are somewhat arbitrarily divided into general groupings. For details of each dataset, click on the link. For an overview of data resources, see the Datasets vignette.

Case/test tracking data resources

Access datasets that provide insight into how much and where people are moving and how those metrics change over time.

align_to_baseline()

Align case tracking locations (for example) to a common baseline

beoutbreakprepared_data()

Individual-level data contributed from around the world

bulk_estimate_Rt()

Estimate R(t) for all locales in a case-tracking dataset

combined_us_cases_data()

gather US states confirmed cases from multiple sources

coronadatascraper_data()

Time series cases, hospitalizations, and testing from Corona Data Scraper project

covidtracker_data()

US State-level data including test results

ecdc_data()

Daily COVID-19 deaths and confirmed cases from the European CDC

estimate_Rt()

Estimate R(t) from cumulative case time series

jhu_data()

Global COVID-19 data from JHU CSSEGIS

nytimes_county_data() nytimes_state_data()

United States county and state level data from the New York Times

owid_data()

Our world in data worldwide cases and tests

plot_epicurve()

Plot a (set of) epidemic curve(s)

test_and_trace_data()

Testing and tracing statistics for United States from testandtrace.com

usa_facts_data()

United States state and county level data from USAFacts

who_cases()

Global case tracking from the World Health Organization (WHO)

Mobility data resources

Access datasets that provide insight into how much and where people are moving and how those metrics change over time.

apple_mobility_data()

descartes_mobility_data()

google_mobility_data()

Non-pharmaceutical interventions

Datasets that catalog details of NPI in the US and Internationally.

acaps_government_measures_data()

ACAPS government measures catalogs worldwide COVID-19 government interventions

coronanet_government_response_data()

CoronaNet government policy response database

government_policy_timeline()

Longitudinal tracking of government interventions to combat COVID-19

us_state_distancing_policy()

United States social distancing policies for COVID-19

Line lists

Line lists are collections of individual cases and their characteristics.

beoutbreakprepared_data()

Individual-level data contributed from around the world

cov_glue_lineage_data()

COVID GLUE datasets

cov_glue_newick_data()

COVID GLUE Newick tree

Excess deaths

‘Excess mortality’ refers to the difference between deaths from all causes during the pandemic and the historic seasonal average. For many jurisdictions for which data are available, this figure is higher than the official Covid-19 fatalities that are published by governments each day. While not all of these deaths are necessarily attributable to the disease, it does leave a number of unexplained deaths that suggests that the official figures of deaths attributed may significant undercounts of the pandemic’s impact.

cdc_excess_deaths()

US CDC excess deaths by week from 2018 to present

economist_excess_deaths()

Excess deaths during covid for US and selected countries

financial_times_excess_deaths()

Excess deaths tracking by Financial Times

Plotting and visualization

These are special purpose helper plots for sars2pack. Note that most are simply wrappers around ggplot2 and friends.

align_to_baseline()

Align case tracking locations (for example) to a common baseline

plot_epicurve()

Plot a (set of) epidemic curve(s)

These datasets include miscellaneous enrichment datasets for joining with COVID-19 datasets or represent one-off data types.

sars2pack: Easy access to and use of iconic COVID-19 data resource

si_cens_G

MCMC-based model for SI, Gamma family used for censored-data likelihood

si_cens_L

MCMC-based model for SI, lognormal family used for censored-data likelihood

si_cens_W

MCMC-based model for SI, Weibull family used for censored-data likelihood

si_pos_G

MCMC-based model for SI, Gamma family used for positive-data likelihood

si_pos_L

MCMC-based model for SI, lognormal family used for positive-data likelihood

si_pos_W

MCMC-based model for SI, Weibull family used for positive-data likelihood

trim leading repeats of a given value from a vector
